p: To determine whether these conclusions are sensitive to the pulling speed used in the SMD simulations we have performed simulations in which the pulling speed is 5-fold larger, i.e. v = 25 m/s. Compared to the 5 m/s case, the rupture force and non-equilibrium work are higher for both ErmCL and H-NS. However, ErmCL still has a larger F max and W pull than H-NS (Figure S2 and Table S1) indicating that, consistent with the slower pulling speed, ErmCL is harder to pull through the tunnel than H-NS. Thus, our conclusions do not depend on pulling speed. In the rest of this study we report results in which v = 5 m/s in the SMD simulations.
